title: Health Care
description: Michael leaves Dwight in charge of picking the new healthcare plan for the staff, with disastrous results ahead.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam. Pamela. Pam-elama-ding-dong. Making copies.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm not making any copies.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Let's go. Messages. Stat. Lots to do, lots to do. Information superhighway.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Nothing new.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Lay them on me. What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: There's nothing new.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's not what you said earlier.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, do you want me to repeat the messages that I gave you before for the... [nods toward camera]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The most sacred thing I do is care and provide for my workers, my family. I give them money. I give them food. Not directly, but through the money. I heal them. Today, I am in charge of picking a great new health care plan. Right? That's what this is all about. Does that make me their doctor? Um... Yes, in a way. Yeah, like a specialist.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: So, which health plan have you decided on?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am going to go with the best, Jan. I am going to go with the one with the acupuncture, therapeutic massage, you know, the works.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Wait, acupuncture? None of the plans have acupuncture. Have you looked at them closely Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I think it was you who didn't look closely enough at the Gold Plan.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: The Gold Plan? I'm not even on that plan.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I'd recommend it. It's very good.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You gotta crack these things open.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: You know the whole reason that we're doing this, is to save money. So you just need to pick a provider and choose the cheapest plan.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, that is kind of a tough assignment. Um... It won't be popular decision around the old orifice.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: It's your job. So...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, it's a suicide mission, you know.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael... maybe... I mean...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There, there...

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Sometimes a manager, like yourself, has to deliver the bad news to the employees. I do it all the time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [scoffs] When have you ever done that?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I'm doing it right now. To you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Last night on Trading Spouses, there's... have you seen it?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No. I have a life.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Interesting, what's that like?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You should try it sometime.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow. But then who would watch my TV? That is...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [laughs]... your problem.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jimbo! Ha haaaaa. Ah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There's a decision that needs to be made, and I'm having an unbelievably a busy day. So I'm going to let you pick a health care plan for our office and then explain it to your co-workers.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Gosh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That is a great offer. Thank you. I really think I should be concentrating on sales.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. I just don't think this is the kind of task, that I... am going to do. You know who would be great for this?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Any time Michael asks me to do anything, I just tell him that Dwight should do it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes. I can do it. I'm your man.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Right now, this is just a job. If I advance any higher in this company then this would be my career. And uh, well, if this were my career, I'd have to throw myself in front of a train.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, first, let's go over some parameters. How many people can I fire?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah, none. You're picking a health care plan.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, we'll table that for the time being. Two, I'll need an office. I think the conference room should be fine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You can use the conference room as a temporary workspace.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [to self] Yes, I have an office. [to camera] Bigger than his.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nope, you cannot use it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, I take it back, it's a workspace.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Temporary workspace. You can use it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: If Dwight fails, then that is strike two, and good for me for, ah, for giving him a second chance. And if he succeeds, then, you know, no one will be prouder than I am. I groomed him. I made him what he is today. Unless he fails, and we've talked about that already.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What did I do? I did my job. I slashed benefits to the bone. I saved this company money. Was I too harsh? Maybe. I don't believe in coddling people.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: In the wild, there is no health care. In the wild, health care is, "Ow, I hurt my leg. I can't run. A lion eats me and I'm dead." Well, I'm not dead. I'm the lion. You're dead.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: There's no dental, there's no vision, there's a $1,200 deductible.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on phone] Pam, Michael Scott. How's tricks?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Where are you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, I am in my office. I am swamped. I have work up to my ears I'm busy, busy, busy. Can't step away. I just wanted to check in and see how everybody's doing. Everybody cool out there?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Actually, people are really unhappy. Um, Dwight sent around this memo and people are freaking out 'cause the...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam! Whoa, whoa, I'm sorry, I'm sorry, I, I, I, I gotta go. I'm getting a call.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No you're not.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I have to make a call after I finish... my work. You know what? Uh, just don't let anybody in my office under any conditions today. I'm just too busy. Too swamped, you know? I am unreachable. I am incommunicado, capisce?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you, Oh, gah, here we go again. Gotta go, I have to take this.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Still no one calling.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dwight, what...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh, knock, please. Please knock. This is an office.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It says "workspace".

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Same thing.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: If it's the same thing, then why did you write "workspace"?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Just knock, Please? As a sign of respect for your superior.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You are not my superior.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh gee, then why do I have an office?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I thought it was a workspace?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: OK. Dwight. Are you really in charge of picking the health care plan?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes. And my decision in final.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: This is a ridiculously awful plan. Because you cut everything.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Aww, times are tough, Pam. Deal with it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You cut more than you had to, didn't you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, why did you do that? You work here, don't you want good insurance?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Don't need it. Never been sick. Perfect immune system.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK, well, if you've never been sick, then you don't have any antibodies.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I don't need them. Superior genes. I'm a Schrute. And superior brain power. Through concentration, I can raise and lower my cholesterol at will.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Why would you want to raise your cholesterol?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So I can lower it.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: He literally won't come out of his office.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: He's got to come out sometime. To go to the bathroom.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Kevin! That's inappropriate.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Michael, can I talk to you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah, uh, I would love to, but I am really busy. Rain check?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Michael. Michael, please, can we talk to you about this memo?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah, what? Which memo?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dwight's health care memo. I told you about it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Is it a good plan?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's a great plan. It saves the company a fortune.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It's like a pay decrease.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, he made huge cuts.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Cuts? What? Wow, Dwight, did you make cuts?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, you said...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no , no, you know what? I said nothing specific because I was so busy. Why don't you go in there and find these people a plan that will work for them? OK?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I can handle that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK? All right. Do we feel good? All right. Good. Plus, there's some other good news. Today, at the end of the day, I will have, for all of you, a big surprise. OK? So hang in there, and I will see you at the end of the day. Right?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: This is not good.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: It's ridiculous. Did you talk to him?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What was that?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You let him walk all over you. It's just pathetic.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: What are you guys talking about?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Nothing, Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do I know what the surprise is? Hell no! It doesn't matter. The point is, they're not unhappy anymore. They're out there thinking, "Wow, my boss really cares about me. He has a surprise. He's cool. I... what a great guy. I love him. I... love him.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, everyone. Gather round. Step forward. It has been brought to my attention that some of you are unhappy with my plan. So what I'd like you to do is to fill this out and write down any diseases you have that you might want covered and I'll see what I can do.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK, you know what Dwight? We can't write our diseases down for you because that's confidential.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, well, I didn't say to write your name down, did I? Fill it out, leave it anonymous. Or, don't write any disease down at all and it won't be covered. Sound fair? Good. I'll be in my office.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Workspace.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what? Come with me. We are going on a little mission. Operation Surprise.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Where are you going?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um, headed out. Part of my busy day, you know. Meetings. [Giggles] Couldn't find the knob.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So, basically, I want to do something nice for my employees. Atlantic City, OK? They have this thing where they send a bus, right, for free. Picks everybody up, you head down there, get to the hotel, room is comped, they give you a pile of chips, and your food, everything just kind of all-inclusive, free kind of weekend.

quotes.speaker: Travel Agent
quotes.text: I don't know of anything like that, but, um, you know what you might want to do, is just call those casinos directly. Um, maybe?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah. I did, so...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wait. What are you writing? Don't write Ebola or mad cow disease. Right? 'Cause I'm suffering from both.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm inventing new diseases.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, great.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So, let's say my teeth turn to liquid and then, they drip down the back of my throat. What would you call that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I thought you said you were inventing diseases? That's spontaneous dental hydroplosion.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Nice.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on his cell phone] Calling you to ask you a little favoroonie my friend. Um, trying to give the troops around here a little bit of a boost. And I was thinking that maybe we could take them down to take a spin on your big ride.

quotes.speaker: Man on Phone
quotes.text: You mean the elevator that takes you down into the mineshaft? It's not really a ride.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Its says here that it's a 300ft drop.

quotes.speaker: Man on Phone
quotes.text: It goes 300 feet into the earth, but it moves really slowly.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So it's not a free fall?

quotes.speaker: Man on Phone
quotes.text: It's an industrial coal elevator.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, all right. Well, once you get down into the mine, what... you got laser tag or something?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, so I don't know what the surprise is. Am I worried? No. No way. See, I thrive on this. This is my world. This is improv. This is Whose Line is it Anyway?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Damnit! Damnit Jim!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: All right, who did this? I'm not mad. I just want to know who did it so I can punish them.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What are you talking about?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh, someone forged, uh, medical information and that is a felony.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK, whoa. 'Cause that is a pretty intense accusation. How do you know that they're fake?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh, leprosy? Flesh eating bacteria. Hot-dog fingers. Government-created killer nanorobot infection.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You did this, didn't you?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Absolutely not.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes you did.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No I didn't.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I know it was you. Fine. You know what? I'll have to interview each and every one of you until the perpetrator makes him or herself known. And until that time, there will be no health care coverage for any one!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Killer nanorobots?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It's an epidemic.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The problem, Jim, is that people who are really suffering from a medical condition won't receive the care they need, because someone in this office is coming up with all this ridiculous stuff. [reads off of paper] "Count Choculitis"

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Sounds tough.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Why did you write that down Jim? Is it because you know I love Count Chocula?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Do you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I think you need to confess...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Mmm hmm.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: ...the fact...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What are you doing? Those are my keys.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Good luck. [closes door and locks it]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim! Damnit! No! Jim! Let me out! Jim! Let... [Without looking, Jim throws his keys to his left, they land on a shelf next to Stanley]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: [looks at keys, continues talking on phone] ...the light green or green...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [answering phone] Jim Halpert.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let me out.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Who is this?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let me out or you're fired.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, you can't fire me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes I can. I'm manager for the day. Clean out your desk.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK, can you hold on? I'm getting the, ah, beep. [presses button on phone]] Jim Halpert.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [on phone] Hey, Jim. It's Pam.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey Pam! How are you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim! Open the door!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Good, how are you? Busy?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm doing OK. Getting excited for the weekend though. What are you up to?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um, I'm not bothering you, am I?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, not at all.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You don't have anything you're doing?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I have nothing to do.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh great. Um, no, this weekend? Nothing. I'm not really doing anything.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh yeah?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I might go to the mall.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: The mall?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I need new shoes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, interesting, what kind of shoes?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Hello?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh, hello. Uh, this is Dwight Schrute calling for Jan Levenson-Gould.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: This is Jan.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hi. Dwight Schrute calling, acting manager, Scranton branch. Listen, I needed your permission to fire Jim Halpert.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Who is this?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Dwight Schrute.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: From sales?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well...

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Where's Michael Scott?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He is not here right now. He put me in charge of the office.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Dwight, listen to me very carefully. You are not a manager of anything. Understand?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That's not entirely true, because he put me in charge of picking the health care plan.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: OK, when Michael gets back, you tell him to call me immediately.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Call you immediately. Good. Oh, hey, listen, um, since I have you on the phone, um, can I fire Jim?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: No. Please don't use my cell phone ever again.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, this is your cell, I thought this was your... [dial tone]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, hey, everybody, Ice-cream sandwiches! Aaaahh! [laughs] Here you go. Take one, take one. It's all good. Phyllis, think fast. Ya-bome! Oh, oh, I see Angela. Angela? Right? Waaaaah! Oh, hey temp. Why don't you take two? Because you don't get health care. And uh, faster metabolism.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Did you get the kind with the cookies? Instead of the...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why don't you just eat it, OK? And here you go, Stanley the manly.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Oh, thanks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There you go.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: This isn't the big surprise, is it? Because we've been having a pretty horrible day.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, nope. Nope. This isn't the surprise. It's surprising, um... because you didn't expect it. But you will... you'll know it when you see it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael. Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [under his breath] Oh, Christ.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I tried being rational, OK? And what happened? The employees went crazy, I got no help from corporate. That leaves me with no options.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm now going to read out loud your submitted medical conditions. When you hear yours read, please raise your hand to indicate that it is real. If you do not raise your hand, it will not be covered.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: What about confidentiality?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You know what? You have forfeited that privilege. I have tried to treat you all as adults, but obviously I am the only adult here. Number one, inverted penis.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Could you mean vagina? Because if you do, I want that covered.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I thought your vagina was removed during your hysterectomy?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: A uterus is different from a vagina. I still have a vagina.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, great. Dermatitis. Thank you Angela. I'll make sure that's covered. OK, now. Who wrote this, hysterical one? Anal fissures?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: That's a real thing.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, but no one here has it.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Someone has it.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Do you think we should go ?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I don't know, Kevin. This is important. I don't want... [spots Michael through the blinds] There he is.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: What is he doing?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Well?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, what? You could be referring to anything.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: OK, the health care plan.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Why did you put Dwight in charge of that? He did a horrible job.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, Dwight? Did you raise benefits?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I most certainly did not.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh come on! That's horrible! Aaah... Thanks, Dwight, for a crappy plan. Ah, Damn! Oh, mmm, I wish I had time to change it, but Jan needs it by five, and... what time is it, what time is it? [looks at watch] Ah, it's after five. Oh, oh it's awful. So, well, OK. See you guys on Monday.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What about the surprise?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh... Yes. Exactly. Thank you Angela, for reminding me. Terrific. Um, before I tell everybody what the big surprise is, would you like to tell me what you think the big surprise is?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: We all think you don't have a surprise.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, I have some news for you. There is a big surprise. And... here it is. Here we go. And the big surprise is... Brrrrrrrr! Drum roll... Brrrrrrrr! Brrrrrrrr!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: When I am backed into a corner, that is when I come alive. See I learned improve from the greats, like, um, Drew Carey and Ryan Stiles.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [clapping hands] God, yeah... Ah! This...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Robin Williams. Oh, man, would I love to go head-to-head with him. Oh! That would be exciting. [as Robin Williams] "Hi. I'm Mork from Ork." Well, I'm Bork from Spork. Nanoo, nanoo. Jibelee, baloobaloo.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, um... Jan wants you to call her.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [heated discussion in the 'Dwight Schrute Workspace', door opens] I did not dismiss you.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Well, you have no right to ask those questions.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You came into my office voluntarily.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Because I don't want my benefits slashed.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well, maybe they won't get slashed if you answer all my questions.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I'm reporting you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You know when ever a worker is promoted above their peers there's always going to be a little bit of jealousy. Uh, it's natural. And that's going to lead to goofing off and that's okay that's fine. As long as they are willing to suffer the consequences.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Michael I need to talk to you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sorry, too busy can't even come to the door.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [opens door] Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, no... [hurries to get up from chair]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Michael, Michael I... [blinds rustle] ... inside.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what. I, um, I'm out the door. I'm going to a meeting. Pam, I'm headed out to another meeting. So see you later. Uh, here we go.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We stole Dwight's trashcan and she found some of his early attempts at his sign.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, here's uh, this is very simple. "Dwight's Workspace," nice.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mmm hmm.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Um, this one interesting the power comes from the font in this one. "Schrute Space," very medieval, very England. Um, this one's forceful, this one's very Dwight. "Quiet! Dwight Schrute Working," it's good.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mmm hmm.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I really heard him on that. This one's interesting I'm not really sure what he meant by this. Um, "Dwight Schrute Privates." Tough to say.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, you know what, Dwight. What if you got a really serious disease like Ebola.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Psssh, no.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, it could happen. Have you ever seen the movie Outbreak?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah. Well, have you ever seen the movie Unbreakable? 'Cause that guy couldn't get sick, just like me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay. Have you ever seen the movie Sixth Sense? Maybe you are already dead.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Unlikely.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You promise these are confidential?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Did you just mark on that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I don't think so, no.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You made a "P."

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wrong. [walks away] Thank you Jim. Kevin. Stanley. [whispering] Pam, Jim, Kevin, Stanley. Pam, Jim, Kevin, Stanley. You finished?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Oh, yeah. Here's the rest of them.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That was... unauthorized.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, it is time to call in a little favor. A buddy of mine runs this tourist attraction, actually it's big. It's probably one of the most popular in the state. So...

quotes.speaker: Man on Phone
quotes.text: Hello.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on his cell phone] Hey, hey Craigers, my man! It is Michael Scott here. [silence] Dunder Mifflin, we supply your office paper.

quotes.speaker: Man on Phone
quotes.text: Oh, I think we already did our order this month.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no, no. No, actually to ask you a little favoroonie my friend. Um, here's the deal. Um, trying to give the troops here a little bit of a boost. And I was thinking that maybe we could bring them down to go on your big ride.

quotes.speaker: Man on Phone
quotes.text: You mean the elevator that takes you down into the mineshaft? It's not really a ride.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, it says here that it's a 300ft drop.

quotes.speaker: Man on Phone
quotes.text: Well, it goes 300 feet into the earth, but it moves really slowly.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So it's not a free fall?

quotes.speaker: Man on Phone
quotes.text: It's an industrial coal elevator.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, okay. So um, once you get down into the mine, what do you do? Is it like, uh... Do you have laser tag down there or something?

quotes.speaker: Man on Phone
quotes.text: No, you just look around. It's a historically preserved coal mine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's it?

quotes.speaker: Man on Phone
quotes.text: Well, there's the adjacent Anthracite Heritage Museum. They got some really interesting old mining tools. There's also a photo mural exhibit. Uh, bat guano sculpture. [Michael hangs up cell phone]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, he's a small client. They don't really buy much.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Why do you want health care, Pam? Hmm? Why do you want it?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: In case I get sick.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Why don't you just go ahead and use Roy's health care plan, huh?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Because we're not married.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: But you're engaged. Aren't you and maybe you've set a date for the wedding, hmm? And because you know you're going to get married you don't have to take our health care plan seriously.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We haven't set a date. [Dwight laughs]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You really expect me to believe you haven't set a date? I think you have. Sure Pam, sure. But you know what, you've been engaged for three years and I know you've set a date. And you know what else, I know you've got coverage under Roy and I know that you wrote down those fake diseases. Admit it. Admit it, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Shut up, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You wrote down... I didn't give you permission to.. I didn't...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm not talking to you anymore.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight, I uh, I have something to confess.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You're doing the right thing. Go ahead. What 's your confession?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Um...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let it out.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You're a jackass.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay. You wanna do this the hard way. We'll do this the hard way. You wrote down those fake diseases didn't you?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No. Was that the hard way?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I know you did.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, then why are you wasting everybody else's time interrogating them?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well, because I want to know who wrote those diseases down.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Right.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You want you to take this pen and this piece of paper and write this down. Write this down.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I, Jim Halpert...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wait, slow down.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: ...confess to health care fraud.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: One second 'cause that sounds really good. Is jackass one word or two? [Dwight sighs] One, right? 'Cause, 'cause of the show, it's one.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: One word.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I've really learned from the greats. The great improvisers, Drew Carey, Ryan Stiles, uh, the Brady guy not so much. He's more the signing, Wayne Brady. Um, Robin Williams. Oh, man, would I love to go head-to-head with him. Oh! That would be exciting. [as Robin Williams] "Hi. I'm Mork from Ork." Well, I'm Bork from Spork. Nanoo, nanoo. Jibelee, baloobaloo. [as Robin Williams] "That's Good morning, Vietnam!" Well, hello to you. You know it would be... God. And you know what, sometimes when I'm watching somebody like um, like Jay Leno. He'll be half way through his step [snaps his fingers] And I will already be laughing at the punch line. He hasn't even gotten to it. He doesn't even know what it is it. So it's fun, you know it's fun having a mind that works like that. That is just a few steps ahead of... comedically ahead of like what's going on. Like I'll watch T.V. and I'll be watching a show and I will think, oh, I know someone's gonna walk in here right now and say something funny. And then they do. Or, um, I know they'll be like oh boy that person deserved to be slammed down. There's going to be some sort of insult. And there is. You know, there's like, "Oh you're... God your butt is fat." And I knew it. I know it's like I knew they were going to say that. I knew they were gonna go there. Don't go there. Um, but other... You know it's like uh, you know Leno, um and Letterman, Carson, you know. Need I say more? No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, um... Jan wants you to call her.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We're all going bowling!
